intro: Flueggea trigonoclada, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its triangular-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with its succulent stems and deep root system. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features. Flueggea trigonoclada is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small animals.
